org.jetel.util.string

Class StringAproxComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.string.StringAproxComparator

extends java.lang.Object
    Class for approximative string comparison

      • checkStrength

        public static boolean checkStrength(boolean identical,
                    boolean tertiary,
                    boolean secondary,
                    boolean primary)
        Checks if for given parameters there are possible settings: stronger field can not be true for whole comparator weaker eg. when comparator has strength TERTIARY field SEC has to be false: allowed configuration: identical: T F F F T F F T F T tertiary: T T F F T T F T T F secondary: T T T F T T T F F F primary: T T T T F F F F F F
        Parameters:
        strength - - strength of comparator
        identical - - indicates if IDEN level works
        tertiary - - indicates if TER level works
        secondary - - indicates if SEC level works
        primary - - indicates if PRIM level works
        Returns:

      • getLocale

        public java.lang.String getLocale()

      • charEquals

        public boolean charEquals(char c1,
                 char c2,
                 int strength)
        This method checks if two chars are equal on given comparison strength
        Parameters:
        c1 - - char to compare
        c2 - - char to compare
        strength - - comparator level
        Returns:
        (true,false) if (equal, unequal)

      • distance

        public int distance(java.lang.String s,
           java.lang.String t)
        This method calculates distance between Strings s and t. If the distance is greater then maxDifference it returns maxDifference+1 Distance is calculated as sum of costs of minimum changes in string s to get string t. Cost of one change depends on strength of comparator and for substitution varies from 1 to 4.
        Parameters:
        s -
        t -
        Returns:
        distance between Strings s and t
